primary_trope.name: prestige_override
primary_trope.hook_text: The Mid South's tier was OVERRIDDEN. Here's why.
primary_trope.mechanism: Zeigarnik effect — the unresolved question (is the override fair?) demands closure.

beats.label: HOOK
beats.narration: We gave The Mid South the verdict: Personality Cult (Positive). The Icons tier. 76 out of 100. Let me tell you what that really means.
beats.visual: Verdict badge slam + tier badge + avatar
beats.editing_note: Open with verdict like a boxing title card. Avatar with villain energy. Music: ominous build. PROMISE the viewer they'll learn the real story.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap + cognitive dissonance (verdict vs expectation).

beats.label: WHAT THEY TELL YOU
beats.narration: The marketing version. The one with nice photos.
beats.visual: Marketing highlights overlay — strengths as bullet points
beats.editing_note: Read strengths in an exaggerated 'promotional voice.' Avatar side-eyes camera. Bright, clean visuals — this is the 'too good to be true' section. CONTRAST PATTERN: this calm section sets up the burst at 0:50.

strengths: Bobby's finish-line hug for every single rider—legendary and authentic
The DFL celebration—Dead F*cking Last gets a steer skull and the loudest cheer
Community vibe—Stillwater genuinely embraces the event, not just tolerates it
Weather lottery makes every edition unique (for better or worse)
$100K prize purse brings the fastest field in early-season gravel

beats.label: WHAT THEY DON'T TELL YOU
beats.narration: And here's what they don't mention in the promo video.
beats.visual: Red flag overlay — weaknesses with warning icons

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Rolling red clay gravel

beats.editing_note: BURST SEQUENCE at 0:50 transition (pattern interrupt). 5-10 quick cuts: meme reaction, avatar facepalm, red overlay flash, warning sound. Then settle into analysis. Each weakness gets its own visual card + avatar reaction.

weaknesses: Lottery registration system means you can't just sign up when you want
Weather unpredictability—you could train for months and get wildfires (2025)
Sparse aid stations (miles 30, 60) mean self-sufficiency required
Travel logistics—OKC/Tulsa airports 1.5 hours away, rental car mandatory

beats.label: THE NUMBERS DON'T LIE
beats.narration: The data doesn't care about your feelings. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Oxygen plentiful. Power output normal. Starting at 899 feet in Oklahoma farmland means altitude doesn't factor into race outcomes. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Mild technical demands. Pick decent tires. The Cimarron River crossing requires positioning where 'some people thought it'd be faster to hop back on the bike mid-grass bank. Elevation. 2 out of 5. Some ups and downs. Manageable. Starting at 899 feet and reaching 1,222 feet maximum creates '800+ of climbing' through Cross Timbers rollers rather than featured climbs.
beats.visual: Score cards — lowest 3 dimensions with explanations
beats.editing_note: RE-ENGAGEMENT BEAT — this is the ~2 min mark. Start with the least bad score, escalate to worst. Each score reveal: brief silence (0.5s), then number slams in. Avatar reaction scales with how bad the score is. Von Restorff: visually isolate the worst score (different color, bigger text, longer hold). [RIFF HERE] after the worst score reveal.

beats.label: THE BOTTOM LINE
beats.narration: If you're asking whether Mid South is 'worth it,' the answer depends on what you value. If you want predictable conditions and a hard number to chase, look elsewhere. If you want a race that feels like a reunion with people you haven't met yet, where the community actually gives a damn. And where finishing dead last is celebrated as loudly as winning. this is it. You'll either love the chaos or hate the unpredictability. But you won't forget it.
beats.editing_note: PAYOFF. Close the open loop from the hook. Avatar delivers final take directly to camera. End ABRUPTLY — never signal 'we're wrapping up.' MrBeast rule: cut to CTA mid-energy.

beats.narration: Full breakdown. All 14 dimensions. Free prep kit. Link in bio.
beats.editing_note: Keep energy up. Don't wind down.
